definition: winding road (twisting and turning like a sheep's intestine)

sentences.english: In restless dreams I walked alone narrow streets of cobblestone, neath the hallo of a street lamp.
sentences.chinese: 纷乱的梦中我孤身一人，走在铺满圆石的狭窄小径。

sentences.english: We are paving our garden path with slabs of stone.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在用石板铺我们的花园小径。

sentences.english: Kasich trails Trump by nearly 900 delegates.
sentences.chinese: 卡西奇小径胜过了近900名代表。

sentences.english: Backcountry travel may involve travel over both trails and off-trail areas.
sentences.chinese: 野外行进包括在小径上和小径以外通过。

sentences.english: Backcountry travel may involve travel over both trails and off-trail areas.
sentences.chinese: 野外行进包括在小径上和小径以外通过。

sentences.english: For guests looking to take a step off the beaten path, the nearby fishing village of Gigante beckons.
sentences.chinese: 客人希望走一步小径，附近的渔村的巨大召唤。

sentences.english: He hacked open a path with a chopper on the way through the forest.
sentences.chinese: 在穿过森林的路上，他用砍刀开出一条小径。

sentences.english: The trail emerged from the woods and he looked up at the side of a rocky hill.
sentences.chinese: 小径从树林中钻了出去，他抬头看向一座石山的侧面。

sentences.english: Bike paths take you past rural villages and farms.
sentences.chinese: 脚踏车小径引领你穿越乡村和农田。

sentences.english: Shovel the snow away from the garden path.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在用石板铺我们的花园小径。

sentences.english: He walked up the narrow path to the top of the hill and stepped into the big shop.
sentences.chinese: 他走过狭窄的小径来到山顶，然后走进一个大工作室。

sentences.english: The path verges on the edge of a precipice .
sentences.chinese: 这条小径濒临断崖的边缘。

sentences.english: A rustic path in Longjia village.
As I was walking along the path, several small animals started from the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 当我沿着小径走时，几只小动物从灌林丛中窜了出来。

definition: winding road (twisting and turning like a sheep's intestine)
bypath/trail/bribery as a means of achieving a goal/minor arts (Confucian reference to agriculture, medicine, divination, and other professions unworthy of a gentleman)
road as twisty as sheep's intestine (idiom); narrow and winding road/fig. complicated and tricky job
road or pavement laid with flagstones
promenade/long hallway/Long Corridor in the Summer Palace, Beijing 北京頤和園|北京颐和园[Bei3 jing1 Yi2 he2 yuan2]
winding corridor/cloister/ambulatory (covered walkway around a cloister)
Shulin city in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
to walk slowly up a flight of steps (idiom)
